verses.kjv: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came unto him, and said unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Set thine house in order: for thou shalt die, and not live.
verses.ct: During that time, Hezekiah became deathly ill. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz came to him and told him, "This is what the LORD says: Get your affairs in order, because you are going to die. You will not recover."

verses.kjv: Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed unto the LORD,
verses.ct: Hezekiah turned toward the wall and prayed to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And said, Remember now, O LORD, I beseech thee, how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.
verses.ct: He said, "Please remember, LORD, how I have lived my life in your presence with faithfulness and complete devotion, and how I have done what is right in your sight." Then Hezekiah broke down and cried bitterly.

verses.kjv: Then came the word of the LORD to Isaiah, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD's message came to Isaiah:

verses.kjv: Go, and say to Hezekiah, Thus saith the LORD, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.
verses.ct: "Go tell Hezekiah, 'This is what the LORD, the God of your ancestor David, says: I have heard your prayer and I have seen your tears. Look — I am going to add 15 years to your life.

verses.kjv: And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria: and I will defend this city.
verses.ct: I will rescue you and this city from the power of the king of Assyria, and I will protect this city.'"

verses.kjv: And this shall be a sign unto thee from the LORD, that the LORD will do this thing that he hath spoken;
verses.ct: "This will be your sign from the LORD that he will do what he has promised:

verses.kjv: Behold, I will bring again the shadow of the degrees, which is gone down in the sun dial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward. So the sun returned ten degrees, by which degrees it was gone down.
verses.ct: I am going to make the shadow go back 10 steps on the stairway of Ahaz, reversing the 10 steps it has already gone down." And the sunlight moved back 10 steps on the stairway it had gone down.

verses.kjv: The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and was recovered of his sickness:
verses.ct: This is the written prayer of Hezekiah king of Judah, after his illness and recovery:

verses.kjv: I said in the cutting off of my days, I shall go to the gates of the grave: I am deprived of the residue of my years.
verses.ct: "I thought, 'In the middle of my life I must pass through the gates of death. I am being robbed of the rest of my years.'

verses.kjv: I said, I shall not see the LORD, even the LORD, in the land of the living: I shall behold man no more with the inhabitants of the world.
verses.ct: I thought, 'I will never again see the LORD — the LORD — in the land of the living. I will never again look on another person among those who live in this world.'

verses.kjv: Mine age is departed, and is removed from me as a shepherd’s tent: I have cut off like a weaver my life: he will cut me off with pining sickness: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.
verses.ct: My life has been pulled away and taken from me like a shepherd's tent. I have rolled up my life like a weaver cutting fabric from the loom. He is finishing me off with this wasting disease — between morning and night you will bring me to an end.

verses.kjv: I reckoned till morning, that, as a lion, so will he break all my bones: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.
verses.ct: I waited until morning, but like a lion, he was crushing all my bones. Between morning and night you will bring me to an end.

verses.kjv: Like a crane or a swallow, so did I chatter: I did mourn as a dove: mine eyes fail with looking upward: O LORD, I am oppressed; undertake for me.
verses.ct: I chirped like a swift or a swallow; I moaned like a dove. My eyes grew weak from looking upward. LORD, I am overwhelmed — come to my defense!

verses.kjv: What shall I say? he hath both spoken unto me, and himself hath done it: I shall go softly all my years in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.ct: What can I say? He spoke to me and then he did it. I will walk humbly through all my remaining years because of the anguish of my soul.

verses.kjv: O LORD, by these things men live, and in all these things is the life of my spirit: so wilt thou recover me, and make me to live.
verses.ct: LORD, people find life through these things you do, and my spirit finds its life entirely in them. So restore me to health and let me live!

verses.kjv: Behold, for peace I had great bitterness: but thou hast in love to my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption: for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back.
verses.ct: It turns out that my intense suffering was actually for my benefit. In your love you pulled my soul back from the pit of destruction, because you threw all my sins behind your back.

verses.kjv: For the grave cannot praise thee, death can not celebrate thee: they that go down into the pit cannot hope for thy truth.
verses.ct: The grave cannot thank you; death cannot celebrate you. Those who descend into the pit cannot place their hope in your faithfulness.

verses.kjv: The living, the living, he shall praise thee, as I do this day: the father to the children shall make known thy truth.
verses.ct: The living — only the living — can praise you, as I am doing today. Parents will tell their children about your faithfulness.

verses.kjv: The LORD was ready to save me: therefore we will sing my songs to the stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: The LORD was ready to save me! So we will play our songs on stringed instruments every day of our lives in the house of the LORD."

verses.kjv: For Isaiah had said, Let them take a lump of figs, and lay it for a plaister upon the boil, and he shall recover.
verses.ct: Now Isaiah had instructed them, "Take a cake of pressed figs and apply it as a poultice to the infected sore, and he will recover."

verses.kjv: Hezekiah also had said, What is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the LORD?
verses.ct: Hezekiah had also asked, "What is the sign that I will go up to the house of the LORD?"
